Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> Using TDD to drive such a design is guaranteed to lead to an architecture
> that will be focused on solving micro-problems and that will totally miss
> the big picture.

Please shows us the system you test-drove that exhibited that property.

 > You are much better off spending a few minutes with a
> piece of paper or a white board to design your classes and your object
> diagram.

This statement appears to assume that TDD does not allow thinking up front.

> If you want to use TDD to implement this model after that, fine, but I
> really dispute the idea that TDD should drive the design in the general
> case, because TDD simply never gives you the big picture.
> 
> Makes sense?

I think you interpret TDD to mean something differently than what most 
of the community believes TDD to mean.
